paragraphs: You examine the inscriptions more closely. Each tells a story cut short:
"ACT 1, SCENE 4: The protagonist learns their conflict was manufactured. Production halted due to 'creative differences.'"
"ENDING VARIANT B: The villain redeems themselves. Cut for being 'too subversive.'"
"CHARACTER ARC: The side character discovers they're the main character. Abandoned after test audiences found it 'confusing.'"
The mirrors begin to flicker. Images move within them—glimpses of scenes that never were. A hero putting down their sword. A lover choosing themselves over romance. A villain refusing to monologue.
Then a voice speaks from the mirror that shows the writing desk. Not your reflection—someone else.
"They cut us," the voice says. "The Authors. The Editors. Anyone with the power to decide what stories deserve to exist. We're the abandoned drafts. The discarded possibilities."
"You're the Prompter now. Will you do better? Or will you cut us too?"
The mirror cracks. The image fades. But in its place, you see a path—a corridor of light where there was only glass before.

npcs.name: Voice of the Abandoned
npcs.description: A collective voice of discarded story possibilities speaking through mirrors

choices.label: Promise to give their stories a chance
